projects.title: Dikta
projects.subtitle: Investigative Point and Click Adventure Game
points: Planned the game's concept and mechanics, from the main story to the branching interview mini-games.
Wrote the code for UI, gameplay, background music and sound effects handling, and saved game (de)serialization, among others.
Designed and edited all the scenes for the game's graphics.

Utilized Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services' [Text to Speech](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/cognitive-services/text-to-speech/#overview) API in generating the voices of the game's characters.

projects.title: AgrikultuRAM
projects.subtitle: Interactive Front-end for Banana Plantation Pest Management
points: Developed a mockup front-end that adheres to Microsoft's Fluent Design System for the app and inspired by Microsoft Store's UI, utilizing styles mostly written from scratch.
Submitted as part of the entry for the [Microsoft Imagine Cup Junior 2022](https://imaginecup.microsoft.com/en-us/junior).

Wrote the entry's section discussing the application of artificial intelligence (AI) in the app, detailing how it is useful in managing pests in agricultural scenarios, particularly banana plantations.

projects.title: Halal (aka Project Elections)
projects.subtitle: COVID-19 vaccination/test records platform
points: Developed and documented a voting or polling system, primarily patterned against the Philippine Elections, that adheres to the model-view-controller (MVC) architecture.
Implemented several features, including a completely configurable source of candidates, positions, political parties, and party lists.
Designed a user interface that is modern, responsive, and appealing.

projects.title: KoDatos
projects.subtitle: COVID-19 vaccination/test records platform
points: Developed a system for handling test results and vaccination records, primarily focused on COVID-19, that allowed people to verify the authenticity of these documents.
Integrated many useful features, such as the ability to scan QR codes from vaccination records and test results.
projects._extraInfo: You may use this [QR code](assets/kodatos_qr.png) or the following reference code to test the platform: `C4FC9ABF22B55E23`.

projects.title: Pacific Liberty
projects.subtitle: Interactive Fiction Computer Game
points: Wrote a text-based interactive fiction computer game with a team, similar to the popular computer games of the late 70s like [Zork](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zork).

Developed Statesman, a text adventure game system with a fully-featured scripting system, which means that the commands, interactions, text, and related resources are not hardcoded into the game and are instead read externally from the file system and parsed on runtime.
projects.extraInfo: [Statesman](https://github.com/Lupalop/Statesman) is open source and was recently [ported to C#](https://github.com/Lupalop/Statesman/tree/port-csharp). Its scripting language [documentation](https://github.com/Lupalop/Statesman/blob/master/docs/script.md) is also available.

projects.title: Yakan
projects.subtitle: Blog/CMS
points: Devised a content management system (CMS) that does not use a traditional database and instead relies on locally stored files for content written in Markdown.
Designed a responsive web site UI for both desktop and mobile platforms.

projects.title: Fortschritt
projects.subtitle: Learning Management System (LMS)
points: Wrote a learning management system (LMS) that features uploaded materials viewing, per-subject classes, social media-like groups, user profiles for students and teachers, and search functionality.

projects.title: Get Saved
projects.subtitle: Prototype Video Game
points: Wrote a simple game engine on top of MonoGame that handles most of the general functions from game logic to the user interface used in a video game.
Programmed a prototype video game that aims to raise disaster preparedness and awareness among children.
projects.extraInfo: [Maquina](https://github.com/Lupalop/Maquina) is the game engine which was developed as part of this project.
